newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rebels kill 15 civilians near Algiers-papers.
newsitem.headline: Rebels kill 15 civilians near Algiers-papers.

text.p: Suspected Moslem guerrillas have killed 15 people, including young children, in the latest series of attacks on civilians in Algeria, Algerian newspapers reported on Saturday.
"Fifteen people, including six children and two women, were victims of a massacre near Douera, in Blida area on Thursday," al-Khabar newspaper said.
According to Le Matin daily, the children were aged between six months and three years.
Blida is considered as a stronghold of Moslem fundamentalist rebels where dozens of civilians have been killed in recent months.
The official media, including the state-run APS news agency did not mention Douera's killing so far.
According to independent sources an estimated 440 people have been killed in the past four weeks by the rebels in different areas of the country.
More than 60,000 people have died in Algeria's violence since early 1992 when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical Islamists had taken a huge lead.
